explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Kiel Canal Navigation Rules (applicable to cargo vessels transiting inland waterways in Schleswig-Holstein; spatial anchor: Schülp bei Rendsburg, Germany)
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels operating under engine power in this region typically follow predefined, regulated channels that require smooth and continuous course adjustments due to the presence of bends and traffic separation schemes. The observed stable speed, gradual right turn in course over ground, and tight alignment between heading and direction of travel reflect controlled autopilot-assisted navigation consistent with canal or coastal routing protocols. This behavior is characteristic of constrained-waterway transit where sharp maneuvers are avoided, and vessels maintain steady propulsion through curved segments. Alternative behaviors such as anchoring, erratic maneuvering, or open-sea routing can be ruled out due to the persistent course evolution and context of inland navigation near a known canal system.
